Using online searches, our own personal networks of colleagues and snowballing (i.e. asking colleagues to recommend others working in this area), we developed a list of 360 potential stakeholders working on climate change and disaster risk reduction in the region (adaptation, mitigation, loss and damage, humanitarian responses). All 360 potential stakeholders were emailed to participate in this study, followed by two reminder emails to help garner a high response rate. Overall, we yielded 42 responses (13% response rate) across five target stakeholder groups in the sample (see Table 1). Quantitative data were analysed using the Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS) (v27) and qualitative data were, using the NVivo software program, analysed through content analysis to capture key themes and storylines.Table 1
